resources.string: A service to play the user\'s sound mix.
A notification with controls for SoundAura\'s background audio service.
There are no active tracks to play. Tap a track\'s add button first.
Your library is empty. Tap the add button below to add local files to your library.
The track\'s name cannot be blank
This will remove the track from your library and any presets it is a part of, but will not delete the file from your device.
Add tracks or playlists from local files
Would you like to add the files as individual tracks, or as a playlist?
The tracks must have unique, non-blank names
The name is already in use
The name must not be blank
This track is already in the library.
%1$d of the selected tracks were already in the library.
%1$d files could not be added because the app is at Android\'s file permission limit of %2$d. You must remove some tracks or playlists in order to add any more.
The playlist could not be added because the app is at Android\'s file permission limit of %2$d. You must remove some tracks or playlists in order to add any more.
Set the duration after which playback will automatically be stopped. You can change the amounts using the up or down buttons, or by dragging the amount up or down.
Are you sure you would like to cancel the auto stop timer?
You don\'t have any saved presets. Tap the add button below to save the current sound mix as a preset.
Presets must have at least one active track or playlist. Tap a track or playlist\'s add button first.
This will overwrite the preset %1$s. Are you sure?
This will not remove the tracks in the preset from your library.
There are no active tracks to add to the preset. Tap a track\'s add button first.
The preset\'s name cannot be blank
Another preset with the same name already exists.
The preset %1$s has unsaved changes. If you load a new preset now, you will lose any changes made since it was last saved.
Hint: You can long press the play/pause button to set an automatic stop timer
Allow playback to occur alongside playback from other apps
Make playback controls appear in a regular notification instead of in the media controls section of the status bar
Make playback ignore hardware media buttons (e.g. a headset\'s play/pause button) unless the app is in the foreground
Prevent playback from auto-pausing during calls, unless the \'Auto-pause during calls\' setting is enabled and the read phone state permission is granted

When play in background is turned on, SoundAura must use a regular notification to display the player controls (as opposed to a media session card). In order to do this, it must have permission to post notifications. This is optional, but without permission SoundAura will be unable to display a notification containing player controls when play in background is turned on.
If you would rather not give permission, or if you would like to save the notification space, you can alternatively %1$s.
control SoundAura through its quick settings tile
Requires read phone state permission\nOnly needed when playing in background

When not playing audio in the background, your device will let SoundAura know that it should pause playback during a call. This will not occur when audio is playing in the background. The read phone state permission is needed in this case so that SoundAura can detect when a call is ongoing and pause playback accordingly.
This setting will determine how playback will respond to an audio device change that results in a volume of zero (e.g. disconnecting a headset while the phone\'s speakerphone volume is zero).
Automatically stop the app\'s background service if the app is not in the foreground (playback will only pause if the app is in the foreground).

Playback will automatically resume if another audio device change results in a greater than zero media volume (e.g. you reconnect a headset). This setting may result in slightly higher battery usage due to the app remaining in a paused state in the background.
This setting will result in the highest battery usage because the app will remain playing even though it cannot be heard.
In addition to its notification, you can control SoundAura through a quick settings tile.
To add it to your active quick settings tiles, tap the fully expanded status bar\'s edit button, and drag the SoundAura tile into your list of current tiles.
Help! I can\'t figure out how to add tiles.

The button to edit your quick settings tiles might appear differently depending on your device manufacturer and Android version. Try searching \'edit quick settings tiles\' along with your device manufacturer on an internet search engine.
Tapping the tile will toggle SoundAura\'s background audio service between its playing and stopped states. Long tapping the tile will open SoundAura.
If you would like to hide SoundAura\'s notification to save space, you can hide it yourself in the %1$s. Tap \'Notifications\' and disable the \'Player controls\' notification.
Tracks will restart from the beginning instead of resuming
SoundAura does not collect, store, or transmit any personal information.
SoundAura is an open source ambient sound app. The source code is available under the terms of the Apache License, version 2.0.
